citations.narrative:
One of the farm dogs was seen going underneath a gate into the enclosure housing a zebra and a zedonk. The
ground/dirt has eroded/been compacted in two areas under the gate leaving an opening large enough for the dog to
wiggle underneath the gate and enter the enclosure with the zebra and zedonk. The zebra and zedonk did not appear
distressed by the dog and just ignored him.
Housing facilities for the animals must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury, contain the animals, and keep out other animals.
The zebra enclosure must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair.

The water receptacle for the zebra needs to be cleaned. The receptacle is dirty. The water is opaque green in color and
green plant material was seen floating in the water. Algae like growth was seen on the sides of the receptacle.
Water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary to provide potable water for the animals.
The water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.
Correct by 6/16/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensees.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
One of the farm dogs was seen going underneath a gate into the enclosure housing a zebra and a zedonk. The 
ground/dirt has eroded/been compacted in two areas under the gate leaving an opening large enough for the dog to 
wiggle underneath the gate and enter the enclosure with the zebra and zedonk. The zebra and zedonk did not appear 
distressed by the dog and just ignored him.  
Housing facilities for the animals must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from 
injury, contain the animals, and keep out other animals.  
The zebra enclosure must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The water receptacle for the zebra needs to be cleaned. The receptacle is dirty. The water is opaque green in color and 
green plant material was seen floating in the water. Algae like growth was seen on the sides of the receptacle.  
Water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary to provide potable water for the animals.  
The water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.  
Correct by 6/16/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensees.
